I was first told about this game by my crush from school: Amber Auld. She said that this game was "life". So when I first joined Steam, I thought I could give this game a try since it was on sale for only two dollars. When I played it, it was really good. Ironically, I spent more hours on this game then the Sonic games I got on Steam. Amber was right about this being such a good game.
NICE GAME !

Valve and their inabality to count to three is a dream that breaks gamer's hearts everywhere. The main negative with Portal 2 is that there will never be another one. It seems that Steam is comitted all it's resoursces to being the biggest online game store and has all but given up up on sequels to Half-Life, Left for Dead and the beloved Portal series. 

This game is truly something special as it mixed comedy with some of the best puzzling availabe in any video game. Who doesn't love the twisted and deranged Glados constantly going to war with the silent Chell. Portal 2 did everything bigger and better. There were more cinematic moments, the inclusion of slime to mix things up and the exploration of the entire facility. Hell, they even added multiplayer to continue the antics with a buddy. The Portal series still has so much potential to explore, few games create every create a truly unique experience. But hey, smile because it happened right?

Its a masterpiece its a 10/10

i know everybody raves on about how good this game is and i know i'm pretty late to the party - this is a truly fantastic game!

I'm stuck in the house for the next few weeks, was bored, i've got an old 2011 mac that's pretty slow and this game works really well.

Excellent playability, excellent progression and where the hell has the last four hours gone??!?!

Excellent puzzle game with an interesting backdrop and story. I found Gladys (the enemy) engaging and funny. The graphics are very good and you won't find many games out there with the unique style this one has.  Every gamer worth their weight in salt needs to have played the Portal Games. This one was arguably better than the first.
1st one better but that's like comparing two masterpieces.

Portal 2 was a very important game in my childhood, and so will always have a special place in my heart. I would strongly recommend this game to anyone who hasnâ€™t already played it, as it is one of the best games of all time on almost all lists. 

The game is split up into three main acts, each with their own unique feel and place in the lore of the game. The first act is Aperture Science as we know and love, except we see it very run-down from the aftermath of the first game. The second act takes the player back through Apertureâ€™s past, exploring the origins of some of the characters as well as the development of the portal gun. The third segment is as action-packed as a puzzle platformer can be as the storyline climaxes in one last fight.

Throughout the game, we see some very interesting development of GLaDOS in her character arc. The game has the same dry, witty humor as the last one. (I think 2â€™s humor is better, though) Stephen Merchant as Wheatley was a great casting choice, as the humor told through the character is very much Merchantâ€™s style. Our mute protagonist once again allows the player to step into the action as much as possible, without the immersion-breaking (if slight) from a main character talking independently of the player.

The soundtrack is awesome, but still doesnâ€™t impede on the rest of the game. The music is very unintrusive at most points, but makes itself heard at key points in levels, making the player feel good about having figured something out.

Overall, Valve did a very good job in designing this game. The soundtrack is awesome, the gameplay is challenging and fun, and the story is very enjoyable and (at least for me) continues to be a fun experience to come back to once in a while. The player levels are a really cool way to continue enjoying the game after having beaten it a few times, and the co-op levels could almost be a game by themselves. Again, I would strongly recommend this to anyone who doesnâ€™t already own the game because of its wonderful contributions to the gaming community.
